title: Green Beans with Browned Butter and Balsamic Vinegar
ingredients: 1½ pounds string beans, trimmed to approximately 3- to 4-inch segments
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Combine the butter, vinegar, salt and pepper in a heavy medium skillet over medium heat.  Cook until the mixture begins to brown, stirring constantly, about 4 minutes, then remove it from the heat and set aside.

Blanch the beans in a large pot of salted boiling water until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes.  Drain them in a colander and transfer them to the serving dish.  Spoon the browned butter sauce over the beans and serve.
Source:  Great Cook Great Party:  A Leisurely Labor Day Lunch by Judy Peterson-Nedry, Bon Appétit, September 1989.
